reviewText: I've seen a lot of great anime, but this one will always be my favorite.  The story has all the aspects of a really good romantic comedy: it can make you laugh and I think that it is the only anime thus far that has made me cry.  This tied in with the wonderfully developed characters, amazing seiyuu, and great animation makes this anime all the more endearing.  It's a must see for anyone who truly loves the genre.The one thing wrong with the DVD realse of this anime is the fact that it is two volumes.  All five OVAs would easily have fit onto one DVD, and ($) for two and a half hours of anime and mediocre extras seems a trifle expensive.  But because the anime is so good, I would say it is definitely worth it (and it costs far less than the 5-volume VHS version).
Title: N/A

reviewText: Oh, My Goddess or Ah, Megami-sama is a cute and endearing series which is a nice break from the repetitive bloodshed, giants robots, and transforming school girls.  Don't get me wrong I love those shows to but this is a nice break away from that.This is the story of a boy who is calling for take out, dials the wrong number, reaches the great beyond, and contacts a goddess who gets bound to him by the powers that be.  The whole story revolves around their love and the problems that having a goddess in the house can present.This is the ultimate masculine fulfilment series.  Sort of like 'I dream of Jeanie only not as problematic'.  The characters are very endearing, the music is brilliant, the animation is so beautifully done you will wish you were a part of the series.  I highly suggest this for anyone.  It's a beautiful romance film with a lot of chuckles in between.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is the type of show you watch to feel good about yourself and everything around you. There aren't any monsters or world-ending crises to deal with--the worst Keiichi and Belldandy have to deal with are finding a house and a minor misunderstanding with a love potion. Other than that, they basically bask in each other's love.Oh, and let me clarify something. I own all of the books currently in English, both dvds, and the movie. Despite what you may think, this is not like Tenchi Muyo or Love Hina. Belldandy is the only one with the hots for Keiichi. Urd treats ALL MALES like that, with the teasing and (for some) the kissing. That is just the way Urd's mind works. So her little scene with Keiichi meant nothing. And Skuld hates Keiichi, with all her heart, at least at this point.

reviewText: Oh My Goddess is a romance anime. It can make you cry, laugh, or feel so good inside. Is this the type of anime you are looking for? Well, this is one of those anime classics you just have to watch.

reviewText: It starts with ep. 1... While Keiichi is attempting to order some food, Keiichi accidentally contacts the Goddess Hepline. Soon Afterwards, Belldandy appears offering Keiichi a single wish. Thinking that the whole thing is prank, he asks Belldandy to stay with forever. With the wish approved, the two find themselves irrevocably linked by the Ultimate Force.and in ep. 2... A mysterious video appears at Keiichi's door. While playing the video, Urd steps out of it. She explains that she is Belldandy's older sister and that she has come to help Keiichi and Belldandy's relationship blossom. Keiichi brings belldandy to the beach where Urd plots to get the two together.In the 3rd ep.... Just when Keiichi and Belldandy are getting used to life with Urd, a new visitor adds to their already complicated relationship. Skuld, Belldandy's younger sister, wants her to return to the heavens. When Keiichi gets stuck representing the Auto Club in the University Drag Race, Skuld siezes the oppurtunity to hatch a plot to get her sister back.
Title: N/A

reviewText: "Oh My Goddess" (or "Ah! My Goddess") is a sweet, 5-part, romantic-comedy anime series based off of the manga of the same title.  It technically falls into the "harem" genre (loser guy surrounded by hot babes), but it doesn't follow the standard formula.  In this DVD, we have the first three episodes.  These three episodes set the table to introduce us to the main characters and major supporting characters.The story is pushed very fast -- too fast in my opinion.  So the main characters of Keiichi and Belldandy suffer from a lack of development.  Supporting characters of Skuld and Urd have more development with less screen time.  However, the sweetness and wholesomeness of the romance between Keiichi and Belldandy covers a lot of ground.The DVD is done by AnimEigo and they did an outstanding job.  The Enlish dub is very well done.  Liberties are taken with the English version of the script, but I actually found that this was not offensive to me.  And things like the title "sempai" are actually used in the English version!  The English subtitles are nearly dead-on in being a literal translation of the original Japanese.  This is very appreciated, especially to one learning Japanese!Another welcome extra on the DVD is the English cast and director having audio commentary.  They do give out some interesting information about certain things (like why they didn't do a literal English dub translation in spots).  They crack a lot of jokes which are quite funny as they watch the episodes.Bottom line:  Anime fans of "Love Hina" or "Hand Maid May" should get this DVD!  Purist will appreciate the job done on the English subtitles.
Title: N/A

reviewText: After viewing the theatrical version, I started a search for any Ah! My Goddess anime.  When I located the two DVDs with the 5 OVA episodes, I had to get them, and the purchase was worth it!The animation isn't the same quality as the movie, but the story is wonderful.  The meeting of Keiichi and Belldandy is great, especially after his "senpai" return home.  From the beginning, you can see the strength of the bond between the central characters.We are introduced to Urd in the second episode, and she displays her idea of romance.  Her meddling results in trouble for the "happy" couple and lands her on earth semi-permanently.The third episode bring Skuld into the picture, as she attempts to bring Belldandy to her senses.  Afterall, a goddes shouldn't be MADE to wait on a mere human boy!If you haven't seen this series yet, definitely get it.  The story is adorable and fun.  It's short and sweet.
summary: Definitely worth a look...funny and endearing

reviewText: In my continuing attempt to collect dvds of good anime, I came upon the OMG series and decided to give it a go.  I was pleasantly surprised when I watched it!  The story revolves around the relationship between Belldandy and Keiichi and their attempts to stay together.  The series reminds me a lot of the Tenchi OVA in the animation and how close Keiichi's and Tenchi's characters are.  If you are a fan of Tenchi, you owe it to yourself to look at this series as well.It is unfortunate that the series ends as quickly as it began.  WIth only five episodes, you don't get a real chance to get to know the characters in depth.  It is too bad that the characters never get the chance to go on any adventures of hace a longer storyline.  ...

reviewText: This has got to be one of my all time favorite anime series. It is by far the best "feel good" series I have watched in anime to date and very funny. My other favorites include Ruroni Kenshin, Ranma 1/2 and Neon Genesis Evangelon so I do not normally watch this genre of anime.Oh My Goddess is quite different, there is virtually no violence a refreshing change from all the violence in other animes.  The main characters are really nice people.  Belldandy would be almost any guys fantasy girlfriend/wife. She reminds me a little of a smarter version of Jeannie in the old TV series "I dream of Jeannie".  Keichi although no hunk, is a true nice guy, cute, shy but not really a nerd. The characters are college age so you can imagine there are some scenes with light sexual innuendos.The only negative in my opinion is the fact that the series is so short only 5 OVA episodes on the 2 discs (Vol 1 and 2) and the movie set 3 years in the future. This makes it difficult to allow time to develop the characters of Belldandys' sisters.
summary: A Refreshing Feel Good Series Not to Be Missed
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is just a wonderful movie, especially if you are a fan of the original OAV series or the manga (comic books).The extras on the DVD are somewhat minimal, although the highlight is the inclusion of the first episode of "The Adventures of the Mini-Goddesses" or, more appropriately "The Torments of Ratty, by Urd". Anyone who has seen it before or read the manga will understand what I mean.The animation quality is excellent, and if the story doesn't leave you in tears, or at least nearly so, I would be very surprised.I cannot comment on the quality of the English dub work, as I generally refuse to watch Japanese animation dubbed; I have infrequently come across dub work that I consider acceptable, although that is slowly changing. Perhaps someday I'll watch this with the English dub and form an opinion then. I understand, however, that the dub crew used for this movie is not the same one used for the Animeigo OAV releases, which were very good; this may be one reason I don't want to hear the English dub as I already have a pre-conception of how it 'should' sound.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I really enjoyed this show. A 5-episode series spanning over two volumes of DVD. A college student Keichi Morisato is surrounded by three goddesses Belldandy, Urd and Skuld after making a mistake call to the Goddess Help Office and a contract with Belldandy. The show is very romantic and heart-warming with comedic relieves from Urd and Skuld. Both volumes of the DVD look like having their video sourced from a Laser Disc transfer. It has some rainbow effects and slight color bleeds in certain scenes. Although the video department is lacking, the show itself is golden. I wish the studio could acquire the new, fully remastered transfer from Japan for a future release. Anyway, as I said earlier, the video artifacts are not overly distracting and by all means get both volumes to enjoy the show now.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I won't go into the Aa! Megami-sama (Oh My Goddess to those of us who don't speak Japanese) story itself as numerous other sources have done a better job than I at that task... however, I would like to mention some of the neat features found on this disc.First, there's the obligatory commentary track by three of the voice acting talents (the voices of Belldandy, Keiichi, and Skuld), which though perhaps less informative than those found in some live action films, makes a quite entertaining listening.The audio options don't stop there, however.  You can play the episodes in English, Japanese, or in "soundtrack only" mode, with the option of English subtitles.  Switching to this last mode allows fans to "dub their own Oh My Goddess" according to the disc--so if you and your friends have seen this anime a few too many times, have fun giving your own rendition of the story!The menus work well, allowing you to skip to a particular episode or a scene within an episode.  The only extra I'd have liked to have seen that wasn't included would be an interview with the creator of Aa! Megami-sama.
summary: Great features plus a great anime make this a definite buy!

reviewText: This is the original Oh my Goddess series. It doesn't run 2 seasons. It's only a handful of episodes. The cool thing about it is that it doesn't seem rushed. It's great. I saw this many years ago, and I was totally sold on the Oh My Goddess series. If you haven't seen it yet then you're really missing out. If you watch this and like it, then the newer Ah! My Goddess series will make you happy too. In the first episode of this series Keiichi and Belldandy meet and find the Temple to live in the 1st episode. In the newer version it takes like 3 for all that to happen. This series is a bit more condensed, but all the greatness of this show isn't lost. I recommend this anime to any fan it's great.

reviewText: I remember when I first heard about Oh My Goddess. At the time, the movie was not released, and there was only the manga and this OVA available. Because the manga was not yet out in my area, I purchased the OVA. It's a good way to sample what the series is like, and a good way for a newbie to decide whether or not they like it. However, in comparison to the manga and the new anime series out, it's very tiny and only gives you a glimpse into a much bigger world.Anyone who is well-versed in anime knows the basic set-up, even if they have never seen or read anything of Oh My Goddess. College student Keiichi Morisato dials the wrong number and winds up with a goddess, Belldandy, offering to grant him a wish. Thinking it's a prank, Keiichi declares he wants a beautiful woman like this goddess to be with him forever. Belldandy grants the wish with the slight misinterpretation that he specifically meant her. Yet the Almighty has spoken, the contract is made, and Belldandy is stuck on Earth with Keiichi. However, Keiichi lives in an all-male dorm, meaning no girls allowed!Such is a summary of episode 1 of the OVA. In episode 2, older sister Urd invites herself over to help heat things up between Keiichi and Belldandy. In episode 3, baby sister Skuld shows up, who is not pleased with the idea of sharing her beloved older sister with a mere mortal.This first volume is mostly comedy with some sweet, romantic moments. And for a love story, Oh My Goddess can be rather tame, but still emotionally driven. But as a device that merely retells something that the manga and new anime series are already portraying, it can be rather dull. If you have already read the manga or have seen the anime, you won't really miss out on much. You may even be bored with it. But if you're a die-hard fan of the series, you will like it, or at least want to add to your collection.This OVA is a good way to gauge whether or not you're into the story. If you are, I recommend looking into the manga or the anime, as well as the movie. Creator Kosuke Fujishima created a vast world with more than these 4 main characters and their lives, some characters that I like more than the goddesses and Keiichi. You can also see a great deal more character development than what can be done in a 5-episode OVA.But the OVA is a cheap way to start, and could be a big money saver than investing the manga or anime series.
summary: Good for fans of the series, but there's more out there
Title: N/A

reviewText: After many years since the Oh My Goddes realease, alas, it makes it way onto DVD in the US... All hail its release...I would like to take this time to point out another fact that makes this DVD release heavenly sent (excuse the pun)...Consider this: Anime is originaly made for a japanese audience. Oh! My Goddess is such a short series that commercial companies really don't HAVE to bring it over (for lack of making money). The only release we have had in the past is on VHS... you will save [considerably on DVDs] from what you would be paying before. And this total is actually the price that the Japanese paid for ONE DVD in their release of Oh My Goddess... Hmm, looks like we're making out on this, especially since we get BOTH the Japanese track AND the Dub on the disc, as well as some extras...My only remark is that I was sad that the anime was so short, the manga had a much longer story... I won't complain. I love the series, and it's finally on DVD. Oh! My Goddess is definitely a gift sent from heaven.
summary: Oh My Goddess on DVD?! AT LAST!

reviewText: The DVD is based on the manga.  The three Goddesses are based on the Norns from the myths of Northern Europe (other words, we're talking the three Fates of Viking myths).  The story line is filled with humor, dealing mostly with love and luck and trying your best.  Some of the humor is mature in nature, but don't get me wrong, I think it is OK for kids because of the theme of caring it delivers within the humor and magic. Belldandy is a warm, loving person and a great example. Skuld has her heart in the right place also, when not throwing fits.Urd is a hottie, but also is trying to be a good person.  Not too hard, but she IS trying.  Just don't ask her to stir cake mix.  Trust me on that.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Keiichi Morisato's life has gotten better and better, since one day he accidentally dialed a wrong number and ended up having a Goddess named Belldandy by his side.  Belldandy is the catalyst for a number of things in Keiichi's life happening, most of them when Belldandy's older (and sexy) sister Urd shows up, as well as Skuld, Bell's youngest (and quite a brat) sister.The disc contains the first 3 episodes of the series, with the first chronicling Belldandy's appearance, and her and Keiichi finding a new residence after he is kicked out of the Mens-only dorm he lived in.  The second episode features Urd's first appearance, with the older sister urging Keiichi to take Belldandy to the beach and "make a move or two."  The third episode features Skuld, Belldandy's youngest sister who is quite angry at Keiichi for "stealing"(that's what she thinks) her sister from her.The disc has some wonderful layouts, and had plenty of good traits that I didn't expect from Animeigo.  There are a number of caption/dialogue features, including one that has the voice actors speak about their experiences.  While sometimes fun, it doesn't hold a candle to comentary that could have been directed toward the director and creator of the series.
summary: Disc is ok, but it could have been a little better.
Title: N/A

reviewText: The first three episodes of the "Oh! My Goddess" OVA series are included in Volume 1 of this two volume DVD set.  "Oh! My Goddess" is an irrepressibly cute series, marginally Tenchi-esque, in that our hero, Keiichi Morisato, is a young man who comes to live with some mischievous young women that are not from earth.  That said, the writers do an excellent job in this series of making it not exactly like Tenchi, giving each of the main characters, Keiichi, his sister Megumi, and the three goddesses, Belldandy, Urd, and Skuld, their own distinct personalities.  Even though it is only a five episode series, the characters are developed well enough to make them interesting and appealing."Oh! My Goddess" begins with Keiichi, a college freshman at Nekomi Tech, made to do the grunt-work in his all-male dorm, taking phone messages for his 'sempai,' which I assume means the upperclassmen.  Unfortunately, they've left him no food.  He desperately starts calling for takeout, only to find that all the takeout places are either closed or not delivering.  In a moment of classic comic anime serendipity, Keiichi wants food so badly that his desire triggers an unintentioned call to the Goddess Helpline.  Before he knows what's happening, a lovely goddess, Belldandy, appears in the dorm, telling an incredulous and shy Keiichi that he can have one wish.  He decides in yet another classic moment, that he wants Belldandy to be his girlfriend forever.Kicked out of the dorm for having a girl on the premises, Keiichi and Belldandy come to live in a deserted shrine, where they are shortly joined by Kei's little sister, Megumi.  Over the next two episodes, this little group is joined by two of Belldandy's sisters, the hypererotically charged older sister Urd, and the mechanically genius, but lonely younger sister Skuld.  A great deal of the comedy in this first volume of "Oh! My Goddess" comes from Keiichi's repeated attempts to overcome his shyness and make a move on the wonderfully magnanimous Belldandy.This first DVD contains the first three episodes, "Moonlight and Cherry Blossoms," which introduces the lead couple, "Midsummer Night's Dream," in which five months after Kei and Belldandy move in together, Urd tries her best to force them to hook up, and "Burning Hearts on the Road," where Skuld joins the cast, in the midst of a drag race competition at Nekomi Tech.  These are all excellent episodes.  The characters play well off of each other, and the stories in these first three episodes are charming and cute.  Belldandy is a terrific character, as are Keiichi's two bulked up, often drunk, sempai in the Auto Club, who are great minor characters.  The fact that the major social organization in the series (and later in the movie) is an Auto Club, and that they all go to a technical college is just a great touch.The English voice actors do a good job interpreting the characters, but having watched it in Japanese with English subtitles, I tend to like the Japanese dialogue better.  The extras on this DVD include a slide show of cells and drawings from the series, and a clever 'dub your own DVD' feature, which is basically the episodes without dialogue.  Volume 1 of the "Oh! My Goddess" DVD set is certainly worth watching and owning.

reviewText: This Anime series was recommended to me by a friend. After taking a chance and purchasing the first volume DVD, I was very impressed. The storyline of Belldandy and Keiichi really draws you in, along with Belldandy's sisters Urd and Skuld, and even Keiichi's sister and friends adding to the entertaining factor of the series. The characters are fun and very likable, especially with the English voice actors for the series that really give the characters their personalities.  After recently watching the last two episodes which should be released on DVD very soon, I love this series even more. Now it has become my favorite Anime/Manga series.  A very emotional, charming, and unique love story.  The series is only 5 episodes long, but for those who want more out of it, the movie will be released on DVD in November by Pioneer.  This is one series that once you start watching it, you don't want to end. Very sweet story to watch as well as addicting.

reviewText: That's all I can say about this series.  I made sure to order both this and the 2nd volume.  This volume contains the first 3 episodes.  The plotline has been explained enough, but basically Keiichi (pardon my spelling at these) dialed a wrong number and the next thing he knows Belldandy, a goddess, is in his room.  The second episode really focuses on the romance of the two and is really funny.  In the third episode, there are "bugs" in the system and Belldandy's younger sister, Skuld decides to give her a visit.  In this episode is also a race that Keiichi has more on the line then just his reputation.  And the episode ends at a very high point of the series.  That's why you should make sure you have both volumes or you will go insane after that third episode.The animation and the love story is a welcomed change from most animes and I am sure most people will love this series.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Let me start off by saying that I love "Oh My Goddess" and I was really looking forward to the series' DVD release. It is very sweet, funny and easily one of the most charmingly romantic series I have seen. I am most happy to spend some time with Belldandy, Keichi, Skuld and Urd.That being said, I am shocked and disappointed to find that they split the series onto two DVDs, each for separate sale. The episodes are very short, totaling a little over an hour per DVD (I believe it is 82 minutes for Vol. 1, and 62 minutes for Vol. 2). There are no extra features included. Yikes! That's a lot for two and a half hours of viewing.I find it hard to believe that Animego could not do more justice to this excellent series, or provide more value to their customers. The six-part "Moldiver" OAV managed to find it's way onto one well-priced DVD.  How disappointing that "Oh My Goddess" could not do the same. I am sad to say that this is an excellent series to rent (but not to buy).
summary: Excellent OVA on two DVDs? Ridiculous!
Title: N/A
